Im trying to download minecraft again since my computer was reset and had windows 7 put in. I did everything the instructions said, but when I try to open "minecraftSP" i get a java error message saying "Could not find the main class: net.minecraft.LauncherFrame. Program will exit. I recently downloaded java, sow there shouldnt be and updating problems. could there be any others?
It would be nice if you could upload a screenshot of the folder you "installed" the game.

I believe the Imadethisaccounttocommment problem is due to ticking the "force update" box, leading to downloading the version 1.2_02, the most recent version which doesn't seem to work with the AnjoCaido launcher. To solve the problem, suppress  the ".minecraft" folder entirely, making backups with the build-in backup manager if need be, and reinstall like the instructions say. Then just log in, making sure that you HAVEN'T the "force update" box ticked. There you go. And btw, the .minecraft folder might refuse to be suppressed because of the Java process. If so, just get into your task manager, and manually end your Java process

Ok when i first downloaded this i got a crash after crash, but i fixed and here's how to do it
Download this torrent, fresh install(you can use your old worlds), when asked for a nickname UNMARK force update
then click on enter game, right after start go to mods and texture packs, choose default theme and exit minecraft
open again the launcher and now DO mark the force update, i believe the texture pack installed in this version
is not compatible with 1.2.02


and, thanks for the torrent
For the crashes delete from your appdata file and reinstall it to it and do not click the force update REPEAT    DO NOT CLICK force update

The best way that I've found to actually get a good working legal free premium minecraft account is by going to the following site:

http://www.minecraftaccounts.com?join=47791

Here is a precise guide of what you have to do:

1. go and register, it's free and just make a second email that you will use to register and fill out the surveys, cause you WILL get alot of spam ;D

2. once you've registered successfully go and complete some surveys, by doing these surveys you ears points(ranging from 5 to 50), once you have earned 200 points you can get your own free minecraft account.

Now you will probably be thinking: this can't be true, why would they give me a free account.
Well basically by completing those small ( and free) surveys, the site that will buy you the account will get a small revenue, and that revenue is then translated by them into points( that you can see on your account). your can calculate this way that 200 point is about the same as 15 dollars/euros

Note that using the method above both offline and online will work :D
